ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

ack.description: acknowledge or reject the input request

input.description: provide a json blob to the workflow

The kind must be set to Allocation

description.description: A short description of the Allocation resource
description.title: Description

enabled.description: If true the Allocation is enabled.
enabled.title: Enabled

subnetLength.description: Prefix length when the type is subnet
subnetLength.title: Subnet Length

tags.description:
List of tags that must be included in the IPPrefix/ASNRange received from NetBox
for this allocation to be applied.
tags.title: Tags

type.description: The allocation type: one of ip-address, subnet, ip-in-subnet, vlan or asn
type.title: Allocation Type

spec.title: Specification

status.description: AllocationStatus defines the observed state of Allocation
status.title: Status

com.nokia.eda.netbox.v1alpha1.Instance.description: Instance is the Schema for the instances API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to netbox.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to Instance

spec.description: InstanceSpec defines the desired state of Instance

apiToken.description:
Reference to a Kubernetes secret containing netbox
credentials.
The secret must define the key `apiToken`.
apiToken.title: API Token

checkInterval.description: Interval between NetBox instance status checks.
checkInterval.title: Check Interval

disableWebhook.description: If true, the instance will not reconcile the related allocations based on received NetBox webhooks.
disableWebhook.title: Disable Webhook

signatureKey.description:
Reference to a Kubernetes secret containing NetBox
webhook signature secret. Required if webhook is enabled.
Secret must define the key `signatureKey`.
signatureKey.title: Signature Key

sync.description:
Define Sync parameters for syncing Devices and Cables to
the NetBox instance.

enabled.description: Indicates if the sync to netbox is enabled
enabled.title: Enabled

region.description: name of the region to be associated to the site.
region.title: Region

tenant.description: name of the tenant to be associated to the site.
tenant.title: Tenant

sync.title: Sync

timeout.description: Timeout for API requests to the NetBox instance.
timeout.title: Timeout

tls.description:
Define TLS parameters for connecting to
the NetBox instance.

skipVerify.description:
If true, the app will not verify the certificate returned
by NetBox.
skipVerify.title: Skip Verify

trustBundle.description:
configMap reference containing CA (key `trust-bundle.pem`)
to validate the certificate returned by NetBox.
trustBundle.title: Trust Bundle

tls.title: TLS configuration

url.description: The URL of the Netbox instance.
url.title: URL

status.description: InstanceStatus defines the observed state of Instance

errorReason.description: Provides an error reason if the instance is unreachable
errorReason.title: Error Reason

lastChecked.description: Last checked time for connectivity status
lastChecked.title: Last Checked

reachable.description: Indicates if the netbox instance is reachable
reachable.title: Reachable
